note.p: Education: Merton College, Oxford (matriculated 1698); Middle Temple (admitted 1699); Lincoln's Inn (admitted 1708)

Career: Called to the Bar (1703); travelled in Holland, Germany, Italy and Switzerland (1703-1705); MP for Maldon (1715-1722); MP for Colchester (1727-1734); MP for Great Marlow (1741-1747); Captain of a troop of Essex militia (1715); Commissioner of the Equivalent (1717-1719); Commissioner for settling commerce at Antwerp (1732-1742)
References: Obituaries in 'Gentleman's Magazine' 1759, p46; 'London Magazine' 1758, p685
